This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ECOPLAN.

Historical Background: [...] Oliver Hooker 2015-02-02T17:44:36+00:00 2015-02-02T17:44:36+00:00 GIS in ecological field studies COURSE https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOPLAN;b53dbd1e.1502 GIS course: Introduction to using GIS in ecological field studies.<br>This course will be held at SCENE (Scottish Centre for Ecology and the Natural Environment), Glasgow, United Kingdom from July 27th \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 30th 2015<br><br>This course is aimed at biologists and ecologists who are just starting to use GIS in their ecological data collection and analysis and who have little or no existing knowledge of this subject area. The course will cover areas such as making a map for a paper or a report, extracting information from Google Earth for use in a GIS project, collecting GIS-compatible data using a [...] Soledad De Esteban Trivigno 2015-01-22T11:53:03+01:00 2015-01-22T11:53:03+01:00 Workshop Introduction to Geometric Morphometrics, July 27-31, Barcelona, Spain https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOPLAN;5be431ef.1501 Dear colleagues,<br><br>Registration is open for the course "INTRODUCTION TO GEOMETRIC MORPHOMETRICS- 6<br>th edition".<br><br>INSTRUCTORS: Prof. Chris Klingenberg (University of Manchester, UK) and Dr.<br>Jes\ufffd\ufffds Marug\ufffd\ufffdn (UAM, Spain).<br><br>Dates and Place: July 27-31, 2015. This time the course will be held at the<br>beautiful rural house "Can Juli\ufffd\ufffd" (http://www.canjulia.org/?lang=en) , in<br>Barcelona province (Spain), with option to stay there during the course<br>(all-inclusive option). [...] Oliver Hooker 2015-01-19T21:16:51+00:00 2015-01-19T21:16:51+00:00 Stable Isotope Analysis statistics course https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOPLAN;410d4592.1501 Statistics course: Analysis of Stable Isotope data using SIA-R<br>This course will be held at SCENE (Scottish Centre for Ecology and the Natural Environment), Glasgow, United Kingdom from July 27th \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 30th 2015<br><br>This course will cover the concepts, technical background and use of stable isotope mixing models (SIMMs) with a particular focus on running them in R. Recently SIMMs have become a very popular tool for quantifying food webs and thus the diet of predators and prey in an ecosystem.<br>Course content is as follows; [...] Conohar Scott 2015-01-18T14:23:00+00:00 2015-01-18T14:23:00+00:00 Call for Papers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOPLAN;bae5bb9d.1501 Call for Papers:<br><br>Network Ecologies: Exploring Relations Between Environmental Art, Science & Activism, University of Hull (Scarborough), June 4-6th 2015<br><br>This interdisciplinary symposium seeks to identify innovative research practices and case studies, which demonstrate how the fields of environmental art, environmental science and environmental politics/activism can be usefully combined, in order to further environmental discourse in the public sphere. This symposium is therefore interested in breaking down the categorical distinctions between art, science and politics in order to promote examples of research practice which are founded upon a willingness to collaborate and experiment. We therefore welcome papers that identify methodological [...] Soledad De Esteban Trivigno 2014-12-16T15:49:18+01:00 2014-12-16T15:49:18+01:00 Workshop on Individual Based Models in Ecology using Netlogo, June 15-19, Spain. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOPLAN;76093a3.1412 Dear colleagues,<br><br>Registration is open for the course "INTRODUCTION TO INDIVIDUAL BASED MODELS IN<br>ECOLOGY USING NETLOGO", June 15-19, 2015.<br><br>Instructors: Dr. J\ufffd\ufffdrgen Groeneveld (Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research<br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd UFZ, Germany) and Dr. Alexander Singer (Helmholtz Centre for Environmental<br>Research \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd UFZ, Germany).<br><br>Site: Facilities of CRIP at Els Hostalets de Pierola, Barcelona, Spain.<br><br>In this course, the principles of individual based modelling will be presented.<br>Instructors will introduce participants to NetLogo, a development environment<br>and a domain specific computer language for individual based modelling. In<br>lectures, instructors will explain techniques to develop, analyse, test and<br>document individual based [...] Soledad De Esteban Trivigno 2014-11-27T09:26:57+01:00 2014-11-27T09:26:57+01:00 Course Introduction to Naturalistic and Scientific Illustration, May 18-22, Barcelona, Spain https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOPLAN;71db1e9e.1411 Dear colleagues,<br><br>The second edition of the course "Introduction to Naturalistic and Scientific<br>Illustration" is open.<br><br>DATES: May 18-22, 2015.<br><br>Instructor: Oscar Sanisidro (Museo Nacional de Ciencias Naturales- CSIC, Spain).<br><br>Course webpage:<br>http://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/draw/scientific-illustration/<br><br>Site: Premises of Sabadell of the Institut Catal\ufffd\ufffd de Paleontologia Miquel<br>Crusafont (Barcelona, Spain).<br><br>PROGRAM:<br><br>- Scientific and naturalistic illustrations: Generalities and comparison.<br><br>- Scientific illustration versus photography. [...] Soledad De Esteban Trivigno 2014-11-17T15:40:57+01:00 2014-11-17T15:40:57+01:00 Course Spatial Conservation Planning with Marxan, July 13-17, Barcelona, Spain https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOPLAN;f3fb6074.1411 Dear colleagues,<br><br>Transmitting Science is offering a new course which might be of your interest:<br><br>"SPATIAL CONSERVATION PLANNING WITH MARXAN", July 13-17, Barcelona, Spain.<br>Instructors: Dr. Ayesha Tulloch and Msc Vivitskaia Tulloch (University of<br>Queensland, Australia). 35 hours on-site.<br><br>Site: Premises of Sabadell of the Institut Catal\ufffd\ufffd de Paleontologia Miquel<br>Crusafont (Bercelona, Spain).<br><br>Course Webpage:<br>http://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/eco/spatial-con-marxan/<br><br>Marxan (Ian Ball and Hugh Possingham, 2000) is a software program used to<br>support the design of marine and terrestrial reserves worldwide. Using Marxan,<br>planners can identify an efficient system of conservation sites that include a<br>suite of biodiversity targets at a minimal cost. [...]
